com.ca.mas.messaging

Interface MASMessenger

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MASUser, User

    public interface MASMessenger
    MASMessenger is an interface which enables messaging feature for the authenticated user.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void sendMessage(MASMessage message, MASGroup group, MASCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
      This method sends a message from the current user to an existing group.
      void sendMessage(MASMessage message, MASGroup group, java.lang.String topic, MASCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
      This method sends a message from the current user to an existing group on a specified topic.
      void sendMessage(MASMessage message, MASUser user, MASCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
      This method sends a message from the current user to an existing user.
      void sendMessage(MASMessage message, MASUser user, java.lang.String topic, MASCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
      This method sends a message from the current user to an existing user on a specified topic.
      void sendMessage(MASTopic topic, MASMessage message, MASCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
      This method sends a message from the current user to a topic.
      void startListeningToMyMessages(MASCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
      This method enables incoming messages to the currently authenticated user.
      void stopListeningToMyMessages(MASCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
      This method disables incoming messages to the currently authenticated user.

    • Method Detail

      • sendMessage

        void sendMessage(MASTopic topic,
                 MASMessage message,
                 MASCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        This method sends a message from the current user to a topic.
        Parameters:
        topic - The Topic to subscribe to.
        message - The Message to be sent. Only MASMessage objects are supported.
        callback - The Callback with either the Success or Error message.

      • sendMessage

        void sendMessage(MASMessage message,
                 MASUser user,
                 MASCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        This method sends a message from the current user to an existing user.
        Parameters:
        message - The Message to be sent.
        user - The User to send the message to.
        callback - The Callback with either the Success or Error message.

      • sendMessage

        void sendMessage(MASMessage message,
                 MASUser user,
                 java.lang.String topic,
                 MASCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        This method sends a message from the current user to an existing user on a specified topic.
        Parameters:
        message - The Message to be sent.
        user - The User to send the message to.
        callback - The Callback with either the Success or the Error message.

      • sendMessage

        void sendMessage(MASMessage message,
                 MASGroup group,
                 MASCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        This method sends a message from the current user to an existing group.
        Parameters:
        message - The Message to be sent.
        group - The Group to send the message to.
        callback - The Callback with either the Success or Error message.

      • sendMessage

        void sendMessage(MASMessage message,
                 MASGroup group,
                 java.lang.String topic,
                 MASCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        This method sends a message from the current user to an existing group on a specified topic.
        Parameters:
        message - The Message to be sent.
        group - The Group to send the message to.
        topic - The Topic on which the message to send.
        callback - The Callback with either the Success or Error message.

      • startListeningToMyMessages

        void startListeningToMyMessages(MASCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        This method enables incoming messages to the currently authenticated user.
        Parameters:
        callback - The Callback with either the Success or Error message.

      • stopListeningToMyMessages

        void stopListeningToMyMessages(MASCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        This method disables incoming messages to the currently authenticated user.
        Parameters:
        callback - The Callback with either the Success or Error message.
